comment.author: 39312862@N00
comment._content: Some more data about this photo: www.informaworld.com/smpp/content~db=all~content=a922273805

comment.author: 34465004@N05
comment._content: Shot while Soule was in Oklahoma Indian Territory, 1868-75.  Soule was  assigned to document the construction of Fort Sill.  A studio photographer, he produced marvelous early portraits of Southern Plains tribal groups and also excellent landscapes.  His work is found in the National Anthropology Archives, Washington, D.C. and Beinecke Library at Yale, among other institutions.  His brother John P. Soule also photographed and was noted for their family printing business in Mass.  More research needs to be done on Soule Brothers.

comment.author: 61498590@N03
comment._content: Thanks for the information...and for viewing our photographs.
